ezRNAseq
  • Reference

Graphs

Create graphs

ggbarplot(x, title = "", xlab = "", ylab = "", fill = "steelblue",
  color = "steelblue", sort.value = c("none", "desc", "asc"), top = Inf,
  ...)

ggboxplot(data, xName, yName, fill = "steelblue", color = "black")

gglineplot_by(exprs, groups, log_it = TRUE, title = "", labels = FALSE,
  xlab = "Groups", ylab = "log2 fold change compared to the control", ...)

Arguments

x
a numeric vector
title, xlab, ylab
labels for the graph
fill
a fill color
color
for line or point
sort.value
a string specifying whether x should be sorted or not. Allowed values are "none" (no sorting), "asc" (for ascending) or "desc" (for descending)
top
a numeric value specifing the top elements to be shown
...
additional arguments
data
a data frame
xName, yName
variables to be used for x and y, respectively
exprs
gene expression data (rows are genes and columns are samples)
groups
a vector containing the group of each samples
log_it
a logical value. If TRUE the data are log2 transformed.
labels
logical value. If TRUE point labels are shown.

Examples

data(mtcars)
ggbarplot(mtcars[, "mpg"], top = 10)

Contents

  • Examples
